intro: Hibbertia glebosa, commonly known as the broadleaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers and broad, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Hibbertia glebosa is an erect shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, with its foliage and floral display being particularly notable during the spring and summer months. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
